Fucking hell. This had such a great potential to become a unique doujin where the bitch gets what she deserves, but fuck no. The author remains a cuck, just like the character he wrote.

@Prf.NTR Not necessarily, no one is asking you to accommodate the tastes of the other. If you only like watching doujins to jerk off, good for you. No one is going to judge you by your tastes and the way you appreciate these types of products, however it seems to me that erotic works have too much potential to tell very good stories regardless of the theme and are simply wasted only by a general interpretation, which in my opinion it is simplistic. There are very good NTR and Mindbreak doijins with good writing and there are wholesome and harem doujins that are too bad (what's more, I don't even like these, they are basic, predictable and have the same cliches that I complain about)

And why do I prefer to read doujins than manga? Well, because there is no variety in erotic themes. I'd be telling lies if I said I don't care about the sex part.
FUCK. Now I'm sad... Anyway, I love how everyone gets post-nut clarity and starts rambling about some fictional crap... get a grip, folks.

@Juddeau Agreed, but it just depends on the fanbase over there in JP and their response. And considering him still publishing like this, it appears that ppl still are consuming his works regardless, that's why I just look forward to newer authors and their works and see what they add the overall community. He really sets up the stories well, but it does feel repetitive now

@Prf.NTR I understand it perfectly, and I know that it is my "problem" focus on something that many consumers consider as something "secondary" or "filler", but for me, that is what gives this type of product its charm, it is what makes it unique or special.

If people only read doujin to jerk off and ignore the story, even if they have excellent writing, that's their problem too, right?
Didn't you know that Ntr is a broad topic and cheating is a narrow topic , and it was under the Ntr topic, that's why we have Stolen and Cheating, which is both under the subject ntr

Well, if you're taking the plot seriously and desperately trying to understand  what's the story wants to tell you, that seems to be the problem in you, just like this guy said (qwert_asdf_) in his/her quoted text "What happens in Nhentai, stays only in Nhentai" which is true, so what's the point of comprehending the "lesson" of the story if you can't even use it. But, here's the thing I'm not suppressing you from trying to understand the story, just do as you please. I just want to say my perspective towards doujins

@Juddeau No I think you're right, no where does it say that doujinshi's primary focus is being fap material but simply an offbrand work written by amateurs, and at the end of the day the focus would most likely be to produce a work that is enjoyable, regardless of the material it is. That's why we have non-h doujin as well. Plus, the difference between doujin like this and other forms of porn is that it has that narrative aspect to add to the sexual scenes later, making it more gratifying and enjoyable as a result compared to just nude images. It's totally fine to call it out when it is lacking in certain things, thus demanding a better product next time from the author. RM's works always open up the possibility for something more narratively speaking, especially with the number of pages drawn, but the endings always fall flat for lack of development

@Prf.NTR  BTW, in some weird way, I like the NTR, but when done right.

I consider that an NTR doujin is good when it does not fall into the cliches of the genre and there is character development.

@Prf.NTR  It's true what you say, the primary purpose of the doujin is to have sexual scenes, however I ask:
Is it so bad to demand narrative quality in an erotic work? I am not asking for a literary work, only that it is slightly plausible in its narrative and that it does not fall so blatantly into the so-called "hentai logic"

If it were an erotic comedy, I would take it for what it is ... satire after all, but when they put drama into it (which the NTR does involuntarily) that is the problem, because the author wants that I take his story seriously.

At the end of the day, everyone consumes this type of product as it suits them best, in my case, I focus more on the story they want to tell me, because any author can have good art, but not everyone can make a good story.
